comments.body: This pattern comes up a few times, maybe `TypeParamRef` should have a `paramVarianceSign` method.
I did not find other references like this one (?)
by inlining `ignoreVarianceIn`, was it intentional to do `base.isAllOf(PrivateLocal)` and not `base.owner.isAllOf(PrivateLocal)`?
Yes, the previous implementation was in fact wrong.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +93,97 @@      else if base.is(Param) && base.owner.isTerm && !base.owner.isAllOf(PrivateLocal) then
        relativeVariance(tvar, paramOuter(base.owner), flip(v))
      else if base.owner.isTerm || base.owner.is(Package) || base.isAllOf(PrivateLocal) then
        Bivariant
      else if base.isAliasType then

comments.body: It's not very clear to me than the new code for `TypeAlias`-es is equivalent to the previous one. Is `.bounds.hi` and `.alias` the same thing here?
yes, it's the same thing. The previous code was a bit outdated.
Update comment?  `protected[this]` is no longer skipped
